episode_summary: This episode features facts about camels' mating behaviors, the pioneering female filmmaker Alice Guy, the overconfidence of American men in landing planes, and a quirky fact about John Keats and roast beef sandwiches.

facts.fact: During their mating season, male camels' stomachs actually shrink so that they can concentrate on chasing females.
The first woman to ever direct a film was a guy.
Half of American men are confident they could safely land a plane if the pilot was incapacitated.
The first person to use the phrase roast beef sandwich in English had a surname which is an anagram of the word steak.
